headline.kicker: Letting Out the Seams For Chubby Children
headline.main: Retailers Fill a New Apparel Niche

docs.abstract: Apparel industry is recognizing that overweight children make up increasing segment of fashion market, and major retail chains are rushing to add larger sizes to their clothing lines and special departments for pudgy preadolescents; National Center for Health Statistics calculates that 4.7 million children aged 6 to 17 were overweight in 1991, latest year for which statistics are available; that was 10.9 percent of total school-age population, more than double 5 percent recorded in 1965; graph; photo (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: Like many young girls, Jenna Sheffield likes to keep her fashion statements simple: shirts with kittens on them, pink and blue overalls and loose-fitting skirts that she can swirl around in like a dancer. ''I don't wear dresses much, the top part doesn't fit me,'' said Jenna, who is 8 years old and overweight. ''I just like colored shirts with a pretty design.''
